Project.name: PureMVC Objective C Standard Version Unit Tests
Project.Description: These are the unit tests for the PureMVC Objective C Standard Version.
Project.ReleaseNotes:
Summary of Changes in 1.1
  • Release for PureMVC / ObjectiveC 1.1 / iPhone SDK 3.0
  • Dot notation no longer works
Features in 1.0
  • Compatible with the unit tests for the AS3 Standard 2.0.4 Reference implementation.
Project.Installation:
Installing the Project Source Code From the archive
  • Download the latest source code archive.
  • Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. For instance:
    • ~/Dev
  • You will see a PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. For instance:
~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y From the Repository
  • Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.
Examine the Contents
  • The source code: src/org/puremvc/objectivec/...
  • The PureMVC static library used with the project: lib/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a
  • The header files for use with the static library: lib/PureMVC/headers
Setup, Build, and Run the Unit Tests using XCode Create the Project
  • Create a new XCode Project called PureMVCUnitTests.
  • Make sure to choose the template:
Mac OS X : Other : Empty Project Create the Target
  • From the Groups & Files pane,
  • Right click on Targets
  • Select Add -> New Target
  • Name it PureMVCUnitTests
  • Make sure to choose the template:
Mac OS X : Cocoa : Unit Test Bundle Add the Source Folder
  • From the Groups & Files pane,
  • Right click on top level PureMVCUnitTests project folder
  • Select Add -> Existing Files...
  • Browse and Add the project source folder. For instance:
~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y/src Add the PureMVC Static Library
  • From the Groups & Files pane,
  • Under the target PureMVCUnitTests,
  • Right click on the Link Binary With Libraries folder
  • Select Add -> Existing Files...
  • Browse and Add the PureMVC static library. For instance:
~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y/lib/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a Add the PureMVC Headers
  • From the Groups & Files pane,
  • Double click the PureMVCUnitTests target...
  • ...or right click and select Get Info
  • Click on the Build tab.
  • Under the setting, Header Search Paths,
  • Add the path to the PureMVC headers. For instance:
~/Dev/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_UnitTests_X_Y/lib/PureMVC/headers Build the Project
  • From the Build File menu,
  • Choose Build Results and then click the small icon at the bottom of the top pane that looks like a written paragraph (hover reads: Select this to show or hide the build transcript).
  • Increase the height of the build transcript pane.
  • Click the Build button (hammer) at the top of the Build Results window, you should see the tests running and results.
